reviews.text: We stayed here during the Feria de Abril. During this time, it charges a supplement, but much less than many other hotels are asking... good value.
reviews.title: Good choice during Feria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are basic, but serviceable and clean. Buffet breakfast is included, and has hot items such as scrambled eggs, bacon, and sausage. Great orange juice.
reviews.title: I would look into other options first

reviews.text: Location can't be beat, in the heart of Santa Cruz. We even got a lithograph of the square since it was so pretty. Everything touristy is within walking distance. Even the Santa Justa train station is just a 20 min. walk away.
reviews.title: Charming hotel on a beautiful square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A fine mid-budget choice for Seville.
reviews.title: Check for Hotel renovations!

reviews.text: I would rate this hotel as "terrible," but it had a few saving graces, so I decided to bump my rating up a notch to "okay." On the down side, our room was very basic for the price (two twin beds, a small desk and a TV that didn't work), the walls were very thin (the sourroundings were very noisy around the clock), and it smelled of sewage throughout the evenings (it literally made us nauseous). We were in room 109 - the Don Juan room - and, between the noise and the smell, I can't imagine Don Juan getting any action in that room. Had we not been in Seville during the April Festival, we would have switched hotels. On the plus side, the shower was great (but the bathroom was tiny). The hotel is in a great location and the breakfast spread was very nice. We booked this place based on the reviews posted to Tripadvisor, so I'm sure there are much better rooms in this hotel. But, if our room was any indication of the quality - and smell - of the others, my advice would be to look into other options in the area.
reviews.title: wonderful,charming,friendly

reviews.text: I was debating wether to tell you about this Hotel....isn't that mean!. Ideal if you want to capture the true feel of Seville and its culture. Could be difficult for people with special needs as the taxi cannot take you the last part, which is about two minute walk. Staff helpful. bath and a shower..clean rooms. Very quaint. White coffee is heaven..and you can take drinks up into your room, via the lift. Breakfast good...hot and cold or both if you want and real fresh orange juice, served 8 till 10.30a.m. when we were there, and you did'nt have to check out until 12.00 which is a plus for me, I am only just about coming round then! Lift and 21 bedrooms, so very personal, not like some of the large Hotels. Ideal location for shopping but not your high street stores, they are about 20 min walk but then, I am not interested in them. Local restaurants, give paella a miss, very dissapointing.
reviews.title: My little secret

reviews.text: We didn't stay in the hotel but had dinner one evening in the outside restaurant, it was a nice location for a meal. Unfortunately the food was terrible to the point of being inedible. My partner ordered tournados but it was more like braising steak and my pork fillet was tough and over cooked! The wine was also poor compared to what we had with other meals in Seville.
reviews.title: Disappointing restaurant meal

reviews.text: We contemplated saying something but our impression was that the waiters english was not very good (and my spanish worse), so decided to cut our losses, leave the food & pay up. I think it was the worst meal we have had in continental Europe.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Happily we found a lovely tapas bar by the Cathedral and thoroughly enjoyed the rest of the evening.
reviews.title: To experience Don Juan's story, you have to stay here!!

reviews.text: The location for this hotel was great, within walking distance to everything. The only complaint was that the rooms facing the street were extremely loud. If you don't stay out till 1:00am, you will have a hard time sleeping because of the noise.
reviews.title: Really loud
Feel like you're in the most special plaza in Seville
reviews.text: Thanks for recommending this hotel! The past reviews say it all; I can simply add that they remain right. Make sure to park your car outside the old city in a garage, then enjoy being lost in the middle of Moorish Seville. Our room was large (it accommodates 4) and had 2 balconies. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the food there -- and everywhere. What tapas means is that you start eating early in the day and don't stop 'till midnight! P. S. While you're in Seville, make sure to take a trip out to Italica and then hit the archeological museum. You don't have to be a stodgy Classics professor to enjoy it.

We stayed at the hotel for three nights in February 2006. It was a really nice place and the rooms clean and presentable. I laughed when I read one of the reviews about the toilet door not closing properly - ours didn't either (room 212 if that's any help!!) That said the reception was really helpful, and the location really is great - very close to the Alcazar and the cathedral.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, really close to the Alcazar

reviews.text: There's a great tapas bar a few hundred yards round the corner where even out of season people spilled onto the streets (I've no idea how packed it must get in the summer months!) A really nice place - I'd recommend it! (we paid 70 euros for a double room - but it was out of season)
reviews.title: Atmospheric,accom good and not so good
Postcard pretty, but noisy (and that's off season!)
reviews.text: We stayed at this lovely little place before Xmas with our teenage daughter twice. For our first stay we had a good sized very clean room at the front of the hostel with two opening windows and a huge bathroom. It was noisy at night especially in the early hours with street cleaners, so dont stay here if you are a light sleeper. But for us it was great- right in the centre of Barrio Santa Cruz, close to everything. Breakfast was really good, and the orange freshly squeezed. Being near Xmas, we even had a local walking choir group sing right outside our window one night! Second time around, our room was tiny, dark and the bathroom door wouldn't shut properly (obviously been like that some time) Also hairs in the shower recess. Our view was of a light well. Price was the same for both rooms- 86 euro. Would definitely stay there again in the first room only
